pr_title: Participant manager web app participant details implementation

timeline.bodyText: You already have a bunch of these types declared in participant.ts. Can you move these types to somewhere they can be shared? Having 1 file per type is fine
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText:
TypeDeclared is not an appropriate name. Why not just import them as
import { Participant, StatusUpdate, ... } from '../site-coordinator/participant-details/participant-details'
This should've been identified in internal code review.
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: As previously received comment on that so i have change it.Now i have replaced it.
replies.author: rohithd-btc

replies.bodyText: Importing as * is fine, for only 4 types though it's not usually necessary, it's only if you are importing a large number of types. My bigger issue though was with calling it TypeDeclared. This name doesn't tell me anything about what you are importing, it's like calling it Something. I can't accept code with variable names like this, see also my comment on buttonText1.
replies.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Consider using ng-template to reuse markup (these buttons are the same as above).
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Why do you need to create another subscription to params? I believe you just want to call this.getParticipant() again
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: Prefer using the HttpClientTestingModule instead of spying on the HttpClient
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.author: rohithd-btc
nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Thanks Nik,i tried this its working fine. Actually i was calling httpTest = TestBed.inject(HttpTestingController) inside component().then()  function.Thank for the help.
replies.author: rohithd-btc

timeline.bodyText: participantId should always be true because of your routing
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText:
This shouldn't be another component, you could've done this within participant-details.component.html. This creates a lot of unnecessary boilerplate/abstraction. Please just inline this template (use the let- variables on the template to pass in the callback).
i.e.
<ng-container *ngTemplateOutlet="button" [click]="click"></ng-container>
<ng-template #button let-click>
    <button (click)="click()">Button</button>
</ng-template>
Or just do it the previous way with the button text extracted out, it's not the best but I prefer it to this.
timeline.author: nikklassen

replies.bodyText: Currently going with old approach,as per our internal discussion.Removed the newly created template files.
replies.author: rohithd-btc

timeline.bodyText: Just for future reference, this should be re-emiting the original event, or use void.
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't tell me anything about how this is used. Please use a more informative name.
timeline.author: nikklassen

timeline.bodyText: This should be '@environment' so that it imports dev in the dev environment
